forum.name: Prepare for Session 6.3
forum.intro:
How Likely Is It?

Think of five situations with different likelihoods of occurring.

  • One of the situations should be very unlikely, such as the probability that the grocery store will be out of eggs the next time you need some.
  • Think of another situation that is very likely, such as the probability your car will start the next time you turn on the ignition.
  • Think of the third situation is that somewhere in the middle, such as the probability that a coin toss at the beginning of a football game lands on “heads.”
  • For the last two situations, think of something that is certain to happen and something that is impossible to happen.

Click ADD DISCUSSION TOPIC and share each of your situations and their likelihoods in the discussion forum below. For example:

  1. The next time I go to the grocery store, there won’t be any eggs. (very unlikely)
  2. The next time I try to start my car, which is very reliable, it will start. (very likely)
  3. The next time a coin is tossed, the results will be “heads.” (equally likely and unlikely)
  4. The next time I open my 500-page book and look at the page number, that number will be less than 800 (assuming the book was printed correctly). (certain)
  5. The next time I turn on my computer, dollar bills will start pouring out of my USB hub. (impossible)
